other_tests.findings: Capsular rupture observed during macroscopic examination.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Eight years later, clinical and biochemical recurrence with CT confirming multiple nodules.
Six years post-surgery, the patient exhibited vasomotor symptoms and hypertension again, with CT and imaging showing multiple retroperitoneal nodules.

other_tests.findings: Capsule rupture during manipulation; three months post-op, the patient was symptom-free.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Four years later, vasomotor symptoms recurred, and multiple nodules were detected on imaging.

other_tests.findings: Capsular rupture observed, with symptoms resolving and UETM levels normal post-surgery.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two years later, increased UETM levels were noted, with imaging revealing a new tumor mass.

other_tests.findings: Multiple areas of necrosis found on histology after enucleation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Five months post-surgery, no tumor evidence was found; 16 years later, recurrence was identified with intense tracer uptake on imaging.
